Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2013 06:23AM Alirena wrote: When I read this article the first thing that came to my mind was that the mastectomy and the reconstruction that follows might be harder on the immune system than a lumpectomy.  The anesthesia staff at the medical center where I had my three surgeries encourage breast cancer patients to have blocks instead of general anesthesia.  They told me general anesthesia suppresses the body's natural killer cell activity which is one of the body's main defenses against the spread of cancer.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy carries lower overall survival Afraid Momine

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2013 09:58AM Alirena wrote: Sorry if I freaked anybody out.  Just wanted to pass on what I thought was some very interesting information given to me (three times) by the anesthesia staff at the medical center where I had my surgeries.  I had never heard of this before and refused the block for my excisional biopsy but after doing my own research on the effects of anesthesia on the immune system, decided to go for a block instead of general anesthesia  for my bilateral mastectomy.  There is a lot of information on the Internet pertaining to this subject if any of you would like to research the subject.  I've listed a few sites to get you started.  Please follow up and let me know what you think after reading the articles. If you think sharing this type of information is harmful, I won't do it again. http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19731847 http://www.aana.com/newsandjournal/Documents/effectsofanesthetics_0809_p287-292.pdf http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/14570648
